intro: Prenanthes cymosa, commonly known as the clustered bladderwort, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Araceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wetlands. Its leaves are usually heart-shaped and have a smooth texture. The flowers are greenish-white and are often surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe.
